com.intland.codebeamer.manager

Interface ArtifactManager.Extension<T extends ArtifactDto>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ScmRepositoryManager, TrackerManager
    Enclosing class:
    ArtifactManager

    public static interface ArtifactManager.Extension<T extends ArtifactDto>
    The interface of an ArtifactManager extension for entities derived from ArtifactDto that must be basically handled by ArtifactManager but with specific extensions.
    Since:
    CB-6.1

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkPermission(UserDto user, T artifact, int operation)
      Check if the specified user has permission for the specified operation on the specified artifact

      Create a copy of an existing artifact revision.
      The implementation must call ArtifactDao.copy(VersionReferenceDto, ArtifactDto) somewhere with the passed information!

    • Method Detail

      • getDaoExtension

        com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.ArtifactDao.Extension<T> getDaoExtension()
        Each ArtifactManager Extension also must have an ArtifactDao Extension part
        Returns:
        the ArtifactDao Extension part

      • checkPermission

        void checkPermission(UserDto user,
                   T artifact,
                   int operation)
                     throws AccessRightsException
        Check if the specified user has permission for the specified operation on the specified artifact
        Parameters:
        user - whose permission to check
        artifact - to create, update or delete
        operation - must be one of AbstractDao.INSERT, AbstractDao.UPDATE or AbstractDao.DELETE
        Throws:
        AccessRightsException - if the user has no permission for the specified operation on the specified artifact

      • overwrite

        boolean overwrite(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                UserDto user,
                T artifact,
                T existing)
                  throws ArtifactNameConflictException
        Check what should happen upon creating an artifact if an existing artifact with same name and type already exists at the intended location
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        user - who wants to create a new artifact
        artifact - is the new artifact to be created
        existing - is the existing artifact of same name and type already at the intended location
        Returns:
        true to overwrite existing artifact, false to create new artifact besides existing artifact
        Throws:
        ArtifactNameConflictException - if overwriting is not permitted

      • create

        void create(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
          org.springframework.transaction.TransactionStatus transaction,
          UserDto user,
          T artifact,
          BinaryStreamDto content,
          boolean fireEvents)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a new artifact.
        The implementation must call ArtifactDao.create(ArtifactDto, BinaryStreamDto) somewhere with the passed information!
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        transaction - is the enclosing transaction
        user - who wants to create a new artifact
        artifact - is the new artifact to be created
        content - is the optional artifact content
        fireEvents - true if events should be fired, false to not fire events
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if creating the artifact failed

      • update

        void update(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
          org.springframework.transaction.TransactionStatus transaction,
          UserDto user,
          T artifact,
          T original,
          BinaryStreamDto content,
          boolean fireEvents)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Update an existing artifact.
        The implementation must call ArtifactDao.update(ArtifactDto, BinaryStreamDto) somewhere with the passed information!
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        transaction - is the enclosing transaction
        user - who wants to update the artifact
        artifact - is the new artifact to update
        original - is the old artifact before the update
        content - is the optional new artifact content, or null to not modify the content
        fireEvents - true if events should be fired, false to not fire events
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if creating the artifact failed

      • overwriteAllowed

        boolean overwriteAllowed(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                       UserDto user,
                       T target,
                       com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.util.ArtifactRevision<T> source)
        Check if overwriting the existing artifact upon a move/copy operation is allowed
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        user - who wants to overwrite the artifact with a copied/moved artifact
        target - is the target artifact to overwrite
        source - is the copied/moved artifact revision
        Returns:
        true if overwriting is allowed, false otherwise

      • overwrite

        java.util.Map<? extends ReferableDto,? extends ReferableDto> overwrite(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                     org.springframework.transaction.TransactionStatus transaction,
                                                                     UserDto user,
                                                                     T artifact,
                                                                     com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.util.ArtifactRevision<T> source,
                                                                     BinaryStreamDto content,
                                                                     boolean fireEvents)
                                                                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Overwrite/Update an existing artifact with the copied content of a source artifact.
        The implementation must call ArtifactDao.update(ArtifactDto, BinaryStreamDto) somewhere with the passed information!
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        transaction - is the enclosing transaction
        user - who wants to overwrite the artifact
        artifact - is the existing artifact to overwrite
        source - is the source artifact revision
        content - is the optional source artifact revision content, or null to not overwrite the content
        fireEvents - true if events should be fired, false to not fire events
        Returns:
        a Map of old references to new references
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if overwriting the artifact failed

      • copy

        java.util.Map<? extends ReferableDto,? extends ReferableDto> copy(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                                                org.springframework.transaction.TransactionStatus transaction,
                                                                UserDto user,
                                                                T artifact,
                                                                com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.util.ArtifactRevision<T> source,
                                                                BinaryStreamDto content,
                                                                boolean fireEvents)
                                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a copy of an existing artifact revision.
        The implementation must call ArtifactDao.copy(VersionReferenceDto, ArtifactDto) somewhere with the passed information!
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        transaction - is the enclosing transaction
        user - who wants to copy the artifact
        artifact - is the new copy to create
        source - is the source artifact revision
        content - is the optional source artifact revision content, or null to not copy the content
        fireEvents - true if events should be fired, false to not fire events
        Returns:
        a Map of old references to new references
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if copying the artifact failed

      • rewriteReferences

        void rewriteReferences(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                     org.springframework.transaction.TransactionStatus transaction,
                     UserDto user,
                     java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Map<ReferenceDto<?>,ReferableDto>> refMap,
                     java.util.Map<java.util.regex.Pattern,? extends com.intland.codebeamer.utils.RegexpUtils.IReplacementLogic> replacements,
                     java.util.List<EntityReferenceDto<ReferableDto,ReferableDto>> entityReferences)
                       throws java.lang.Exception
        Check and rewrite references of copied artifacts to also refer to copied target artifacts
        Parameters:
        request - to copy artifacts
        transaction - is the copy transaction
        user - that copies the artifacts
        refMap - is the Map of original reference to mapped Referable grouped by object type
        replacements - is the Map of reference replacements to apply
        entityReferences - is a List where to return all resulting entity references
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • remove

        void remove(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
          org.springframework.transaction.TransactionStatus transaction,
          UserDto user,
          T artifact,
          boolean fireEvents)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes an existing artifact (reversible).
        It is not necessary for the implementation to call ArtifactDao.remove(UserDto, ArtifactDto)
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        transaction - is the enclosing transaction
        user - who wants to remove the artifact
        artifact - is the artifact to remove
        fireEvents - true if events should be fired, false to not fire events
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if removing the artifact failed

      • restore

        void restore(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
           org.springframework.transaction.TransactionStatus transaction,
           UserDto user,
           T artifact,
           boolean fireEvents)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Restore a removed artifact.
        It is not necessary for the implementation to call ArtifactDao.restore(UserDto, ArtifactDto)
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        transaction - is the enclosing transaction
        user - who wants to remove the artifact
        artifact - is the artifact to remove
        fireEvents - true if events should be fired, false to not fire events
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if removing the artifact failed

      • delete

        void delete(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
          org.springframework.transaction.TransactionStatus transaction,
          UserDto user,
          T artifact,
          boolean fireEvents)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Irreversibly delete an existing artifact.
        It is not necessary for the implementation to call ArtifactDao.delete(Integer, com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.ArtifactDao.DeleteListener...)
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        transaction - is the enclosing transaction
        user - who wants to delete the artifact
        artifact - is the artifact to delete
        fireEvents - true if events should be fired, false to not fire events
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if deleting the artifact failed

      • delete

        void delete(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
          org.springframework.transaction.TransactionStatus transaction,
          UserDto user,
          java.util.Collection<java.lang.Integer> artifactIds)
            throws java.lang.Exception
        Irreversibly delete a batch of artifacts.
        It is not necessary for the implementation to call ArtifactDao.delete(Integer, com.intland.codebeamer.persistence.dao.ArtifactDao.DeleteListener...)
        Parameters:
        request - is optional request information
        transaction - is the enclosing transaction
        user - who wants to delete the artifact
        artifactIds - is a Collection of the Ids of the artifacts to delete (not necessarily all of this extensions type!)
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if deleting the artifact failed
